title: How to Make Tchektchouka

steps.headline: Open the sweet peppers at the top.
steps.description: Cross around the stem and remove it, as well as the seeds.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to the highest temperature.
Put the sweet peppers as close as possible to the grill.
steps.description: Leave them until the skin inflates and turn them on each side.

steps.headline: Remove the sweet peppers from the oven when they are well roasted.
Remove the skin.
steps.description: Having roasted the peppers makes this rather simple. Once you have removed the skin, cut the peppers into small pieces.

steps.headline: Heat up water in a pan until boiling.
Take a frying pan and add least 3.5mm of oil.
steps.description: Put the sweet peppers into the oil.

steps.headline: Add the minced onion to the pan.
Add the cooked zucchini, sweet peppers, and onions.
Add some more oil and cook the whole.

text: Open the sweet peppers at the top. Cross around the stem and remove it, as well as the seeds. Preheat the oven to the highest temperature.  Put the sweet peppers as close as possible to the grill. Leave them until the skin inflates and turn them on each side. Remove the sweet peppers from the oven when they are well roasted.  Remove the skin. Having roasted the peppers makes this rather simple. Once you have removed the skin, cut the peppers into small pieces. Heat up water in a pan until boiling. Add in zucchini. Take a frying pan and add least 3.5mm of oil. Put the sweet peppers into the oil. Add the minced onion to the pan.  Add the cooked zucchini, sweet peppers, and onions.  Add some more oil and cook the whole.  Bon appétit!
